headline: Manicotti Italian Casserole
description: Some members of my family call it manicotti, some call it Italian casserole. So I call it Manicotti Italian Casserole. This is one of my all time favorite meals to make, and it's super easy!

video.description: Wonderful blend of pasta, cheeses, and tasty marinara sauce.
video.name: Manicotti Italian Casserole

name: Manicotti Italian Casserole

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to boil. Pour in rigatoni, and cook until al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain, and set pasta aside.

Meanwhile, brown ground beef and italian sausage in a large skillet over medium heat. With a slotted spoon, remove beef and sausage to a baking dish. Stir mushrooms, spaghetti sauce, and cooked pasta into the baking dish. Sprinkle cheese and pepperoni over the top.
Bake in preheated oven until the cheese is brown and bubbly, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Was very good I used Taco seasoned sausage instead of the Italian sausage
This is a great recipe and it goes a long way! I froze one of the dishes and now I am ready to cook it up for dinner. Does anyone know what temp and how long to cook it when it is frozen?
I made this following the exact recipe and directions, and it was very good. The second time I added 1/2 chopped onion, two cloves of minced garlic, and a tablespoon of pesto. It was awsome
Love this recipe, I make it once a week for my wife. She love's it. Yummo.
Its freaking delicious. We loved it!
Really good substitute when there's a "pasta shortage" and manicotti pasta is nowhere to be found. I used penne as that was the closest I could find.
Fast, simple and yummy!

Made it for my family. They all loved it. I made 2 pans from this recipe. I used ground turkey in place of beef & Italian seasoned ground chicken in place of the sausage. I added spices & garlic to give the meat more flavor, skipped the pepperoni & added shredded Parmesan & mozzarella. Very delicious & super easy to make. Definitely will make this dish again!!
This is an easy and very tasty dish! I will be making this again.

Yum!!! Lasagne, but better and easier. I used regular breakfast sausage I had on hand, and Italian blend shredded cheese and Mozzerella. I did add a TBSP of minced garlic to the meat and followed another reviewers suggestion of adding half the cheese to the hot meat mixture before adding the sauce. This was sooo good and made A LOT. This fed myself and 2 grown men for 2 days, plus I gave the leftovers to another family of 3 who ate on it for 3 days!!! (The flavor only got better!) Next time I will half the recipe to an 8x8 pan...maybe :)
My family enjoyed this! I added some cut up pepperoni and some of the cheese into the pasta mixture. My younger son asked for this to be part of our regular rotation!
Very good-definitely good for a hungry group.
Delicious Delicious Delicious..
Family loved it
It turned out even better than the first time. I used a different baking pan.
My family loves it! I have made it a couple times now. Simple and delicious! Highly recommend!!
No changes taste great an fast to cook
Consider using a spicy italian sausage to give it some zip.
This was very easy to make was was very delicious. My family loved it! I did use rotini pasta because my family does like that pasta noodle best. it came out great!!

It was hit in our house, I also made changes and added onions and garlic prior to adding the mild Italian sausage and ground beef. I also sautéed fresh mushrooms... I didn’t use the entire box and more like 3/4, I felt it was just enough pasta. As per the other reviews I also mixed 3/4 of a bag of shredded mozzarella with the meat/ sauce and mushrooms. I quartered Turkey pepperoni to the top and then added mozzarella just to cover. Lots of left overs, all want it again tomorrow. So saves me from cooking... a win, win for everyone!!
The family loves it!!
the only thing I changed was that I did pancetta on top

My husband and I loved it! Next time I’m going to add olives and green peppers! Left the mushroom’s off because I don’t care for them and added onions when I browned the meat. Great dish for a family gathering!
made it exact and the only thing I want to add is more pepperoni, the more the better. so easy and tastes so good

I only used 2 (24oz) jars of sauce and it just barely fit into my 9x13 dish...came out great.
I'd like to add some chopped green bell pepper, onions and garlic next time but this isn't necessary if you use flavored tomato sauce.

I do like this recipe. I made All Recipes' Worlds Best Marinara 
and used Wild Hog for all the meat instead of hamburger. The Italian sausage was made by an in Loreta Fl. Outfitter where I took the Hog. I also added Parmesan cheese on top of the mozzarella cheese. I also split the recipe and froze part of it before cooking it.
Fantastic! I mixed 1 Cup of mixed (your choice) cheese into the casserole as recommended by another reviewer. Super easy and will feed more than 8 people.
All I added was some basil and Italian seasonings. Such an easy dish and everyone loved it!
I will definitely be making this casserole again as it was a big hit with my grandson and my mom.
It turned out amazing! I only used half the amount of red sauce and it turned of just fine. Really good stuff. (Season your beef) (;
This was really simple. My kids didn’t want the cheese. So half with and half sad.
I likes this very much. With only me I halved the recipe and plenty to freeze for another day. I used homemade Italian sausage instead of ground beef. Yummy

Made minor changes. Subbed out mushrooms for sautéed onions since hubby hates the shrooms. Also added ricotta cheese on top as well as the mozzarella the recipe called for. Hubby said the ricotta made the dish. Lastly I mixed half the cheese in with the cooked noodles before adding noodles to the meat and sauce mixture as some other reviews recommended. It was a HUGE hit and the family can't wait for me to make it again!

Deliciousness! I used a half pound or more of rotini, one pound of sausage, no beef. Sauteed sausage with some chopped onion and added italian seasoning and garlic powder. Added about 1/2 cup of ricotta with eyeball amount of mozz to warm pasta and tossed all together. Kept the pepperoni and mushrooms too. So good.
Great recipe to give a change from lasagna or spaghetti casserole which I make often. The pepperoni is a hit!

Was really disappointed in this dish. Is it easy? Yes. Does it sorely lack in flavor? Also yes. It's edible but that's about it, I can make a far better italian dish. And this was even with me trying to doctor it up with fresh veggies, simmering the beef in their juices, and adding seasoning because the italian sausage may be seasoned but the beef isn't and the premade sauce always tastes better with a pick me up. Was not worth the extra work I tried to put into it. The hunt for a fabulous italian casserole continues...
Amazing. Added chopped green peppers, onions, clove of garlic, my own Italian season blend. A tbsp of cilantro. Cooled the noodles with a lbs of mozzarella. Layers. Layers.

It's a good base recipe for a casserole. As other reviewers have noted, it's not really Manicotti, but it's good. If you make this recipe according to the directions, a 9x13 baking dish will not be large enough. I used a 5 Qt baking dish (10.3 x 14.5) and it was just big enough. 

I substituted zucchini for the mushroom, because I had some on hand I needed to use. I thinly sliced it and cooked on the stovetop for a few minutes before mixing with everything else. 

I will make this again. It wasn't bland, but it could use seasoning.

very filling and lasted for several meals. i only used one jar of sauce, and left out the ground beef and mushrooms due to price and personal preference respectively. i tried adding spinach to make up for no mushrooms, but it didn't work too great, so next time i might try olives or another vegetable instead. overall an excellent meal that i would definitely make again!
First time making it and I made it as is and it was FABULOUS! Everyone had seconds and thirds! Will make again.

I personally was not crazy about it. My family liked it. My husband said it was good and different because of the sausage. I mixed most of the cheese with the pasta, sauce, and meat. Then I sprinkled more Mozzarella and Parmesan on top and baked for 30 minutes. I don't think I'll make it again, unless my family asks for it. Sorry.
Another win for the family on a busy night after school. Threw servings into containers and off to sports on full bellies. #momwin
Changed: used egg noodles, mixed ground beef and ground pork, used canned tomatoes and 1 jar of salsa, used fresh mushrooms and fried them instead of canned. Now it's a 5 star.
We loved it!
This stuff is really awesome

This was great and super easy! I used extra lean ground beef since sausage is pretty greasy and drained very well before adding the sauce and heating through. Tossed the cooked/drained pasta in some Italian blend shredded cheese before incorporating the sauce and more cheese in a very large bowl. Transferred this mixture to a baking dish sprayed with nonstick spray and topped with remaining cheese. Sliced up pepperoni to get small pieces in each bite. This ensured everything was well incorporated and cooked evenly instead of a massive amount of cheese just sitting on top of the casserole dish. Serve with garlic bread!
Pretty bland even after I seasoned everything more than requested in the recipe. Nothing to go crazy over. Pretty boring but it did the job I guess.

I made this for the first time when I needed something I could make quickly. Made a few minor changes. I used a pound of chuck, 1/2 pound hot Italian sausage, 1/2 pound sweet Italian sausage for the meat. I used 2 pounds of shredded mozzarella and mixed 1/2 of it into the meat mixture. I used fresh mushrooms instead of canned (‘cause those are gross - just saying!). Used sandwich pepperoni and I sprinkled shredded Parmesan on the top. Okay that sounds like more than a few, but not really. 3 people asked me for the recipe immediately.
good
I just used the Italian sausage , mini spiral pasta, and mini pepperoni instead. Still was delicious.
Came out perfect!
A nice and easy cold evening dinner. My grand-daughter loved it.
Made exactly as written and it turned out great. I will make it again
I have several similar main dishes and love it with Alfredo based sauces. Also, with an offer of complementary tomato or bolognaise!
Put half the cheese mixed in. Was really good!
Family loved it! It’s a keeper!!
The family loved it!

I made this for me and my boyfriend he loved it. He really likes sausage so he really liked the smoked sausage in it. I cut the portions in half and there was still PLENTY of left overs. I didnt use pepperonis this time (just because i didnt have any), but will try them wit h it next time. Solid dish with lots of flavor and very filling.

I used ronzoni gluten free penne pasta, and just two jars of sauce and I added the sauce to the meat after browned. I also added fresh grated Romano cheese to my sauce, did not use the mushrooms, then mixed the pasta with the sauce prior to added to the baking dish. I layered half the pasta added a layer of mozzarella, added the remaining pasta and topped it off with the rest of the mozzarella cheese. The dish was hearty, flavorful and a perfect choice for a cool fall evening.
Will definitely make this again! I did cut the recipe in half, and also put half an onion (diced) and two cloves of garlic in while cooking the meats. Can't wait to try other variations of this.
browned the meat with garlic & italian seasoning - otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly...my crazy Italian husband loved it!!
My family loved this! Made some changes though. Added another 1/2 lb of noodles. Only used 1/2 lb of sausage. Didn't use any mushrooms.
seriously betszam...you're so smart..and guys, how was that such a helpful review?

It was so delicious! The only thing I would do differently if I were to make it again would be to cut the measurements in half. I made this for dinner for my 3 person family and we had leftovers to last days. However, I do think that those measurements would be good if you were going to make this casserole for a party. Otherwise, amazing casserole!
First time making and it was very tasty. I chose not to add the mushrooms. Also, I used Ragu’ tomato, garlic and onion sauce.

Easy peesy! Doubled for 7 ppl. Have plenty of leftovers. Everyone LOVED it. I love mushrooms but unfortunately my family does not so I left them out. I mixed 2 packages of the Italian style pepperoni in with the mixture v/s on top. I browned a thin layer of mozarella and Italian bread crumbs on top!
Very yummy the whole family loved it.
Great recipe! Didn’t have the pepperoni but added 16oz of ricotta to the mix and it worked perfect.
I will definitely make this again it has already been requested by my picky family.
Family loved it .. will make it again !

My family enjoyed this recipe. I used sautéed fresh mushrooms instead of canned and also added basil, thyme and garlic powder to the meat as it was cooking. Accidentally bought manicotti instead of rigatoni, but I cut it up after cooking which turned out fine.

This was a huge hit with my family. I did adjust the cheese as was noted in another review. Half added into the mixture and half on top. I made the recipe using the ingredients/ amounts as listed and was able to feed 7 people (2 are teenage boys that are never full). We didn’t have any leftovers but everyone walked away full.

I thought this was awesome ! I cut the recipe in half. Used hot Italian sausage links (2). Broke them up with the beef.
Will pass along to others.
Halved the recipe as there were just 2 of us. Used some Fresh mushrooms I already had but followed it exactly otherwise. Yumm. So easy and we had 2 dinners and a lunch from it. A keeper!

Delicious, definitely making this again! This recipe, as written, is for a very large family and/or gathering, next time I will cut it in half and should still be plenty for myself, my 3 year old and my father with leftovers. I used fresh instead of canned mushrooms, turned out great! However, very fatty, if you are looking to cut some out (albeit not that much) I would maybe just use ground beef with an Italian seasoning and omit the Italian sausage or omit the pepperoni. The cheese, pepperoni and Italian sausage combo can be very heavy for some. Next time I might try a few veggie toppings instead of pepperoni , e.g: onions, green peppers, olives etc. like a pizza.
Very easy to make, only takes 40 min to bake. All together it takes 50 min from prepping to table. If you like a little "kick" use Johnsonville hot sausage & Classico fire-roasted spaghetti sauce!
Great idea and being Italian I had to change a third of the cheese to ricotta. It is titled Manicotti after all .

Good! But 20 oz noodles is too much! 18 oz or less would be better. I used penne pasta. I also made a full batch but put half in the freezer for a quick easy meal later. I stirred sauce, mushrooms, sliced olives in with the meat mixture before putting in casserole dish.
I should have added tomato sauce to make it more supple.
it was great. made it as written and yes will make it again.
No changes. I did not half the recipe. It does take a big 9x13 casserole dish. A deep one. Excellent recipe. Everyone loved it.

Manicotti has absolutely nothing to do with this dish of baked macaroni with meat... Manicotti is (as someone else noted) long, tubular pasta, filled with ricotta, egg, parsley.. Alternatively, crepes can be made in place of the tubular pasta... No meat in manicotti! Just because someone calls something by an incorrect name, then prints it - does not make it so!
Very simple and yummy. Even better left over. I never change any ingredients when rating a recipe. I will certainly make this again. Thanks, Kevin

Delicious! I did not add mushrooms. Instead, I substituted with green peppers and onions, which I put in with the meat after it was brown. I also substituted turkey instead of beef to make it healthier. Just a tip, I had to use one 9x13 glass pan and one 8x8 pan to fit everything!
Everyone loved it! Definitely not manicotti but still great.
Our whole family loved this dish. Very tasty and easy to make.

I mostly followed the recipe and it was great. I mostly halved the recipe using fresh sautéed mushrooms and just a half lb of hot Italian sausage and the pepperoni, mixed some cheese into the casserole. Even no complaints from my picky eight year old and he complains about everything but mac n cheese
This was a hit for my family! They loved it!
This was easy to make and delicious! Next time I will mix more cheese in.
I loved this recipe, but I did add some dried onion and garlic powder. It is a lot!! I have 2 regular size casserole dishes left over. I believe next time I will cut the recipe in half!
We enjoyed this simple-to-make pasta dish. I used only 1 jar of spaghetti sauce and omitted the mushrooms and pepperoni.
This recipe was easy and delicious. It was a hit with my kids, I will be making this again!
I made 1/2 the recipe for 6 people and there was plenty. I used fresh mushrooms. I looked at other reviews and that really helped. My guests went back for seconds and will make it again.
this is an awesome recipe! My family and I don't eat mushrooms, so I didn't add them. My 3 year old enjoyed it so much he asked for seconds and sang when it was put in front of him ^_^

Fantastic simple recipe. Takes less than 30 minutes of prep time before you throw it in the oven and then you've got a filling meal with plenty of leftovers for when you're in a hurry and don't want takeout. I make this about twice a month, it's become a staple meal for when I'm on the road.
I have made this twice already. Each time I halved the recipe. It made plenty. The only things I added was a green pepper and a medium onion. Great recipe and the leftovers taste better.
Made no substitutions. I was surprised by the complexity of flavor given simplicity of the recipe. We had it for leftovers next day and it was gone. Will make it again and again and again.

This was a hit with the lil one and myself
Wife was not as impressed, but she is not a pasta fan
Will be made part of our pasta rotation for sure
This is a dish I will continue to make. The family loves it and it makes plenty for everyone.
